The outer most atmosphere of prehistoric Earth was a tranquil void filled to 
the brim with the black velvet of outer space with its glowing stars 
trailing off into oblivion in ever-possible direction imaginable.

Red dwarfs, stellar giants and even other distant suns with their own solar 
systems to worry about.

Yet, or all of the places throughout the universe, and all the possibly 
horrible time periods, it was this particular spot in the fabric of space 
the tare reopened with a sonic boom so violent it even ruffled the clouds of 
Earth and spewed out the contents it had absorbed just beyond the planet of 
Cybertron.
Pieces of old satellites, telecommunication receivers, and one banged up 
research vessel flew from the gaping hole and plummeted towards the emerald 
and sapphire surface of the 3rd planet from the sun.

Spinning wildly on its axis, the mangled Decepticon ship first hit the thick 
outer atmosphere of the organic planet along with the other neighbors that 
had joined it into the distortion. But was the only one that did not burn up 
into crispy atoms as it descended in the form of a great revolving fireball 
down towards the flat grasslands of ancient Africa.
The local wildlife having the intelligence enough to run for their pitiful 
little lives as the alien metallic behemoth rocketed towards them.
Those aboard hanging on for their OWN pitiful little lives.

� AH! WE�RE ALL GUNNA DIE!!� Dust Storm screeched as he hung onto whatever 
he could, Dark Cloud included as he floated virtually in zero gravity and 
felt the temperature rising.
He clung for dear life to the jet plane�s leg and began to sob. � I DON�T 
WANNA DIE!!�
Suddenly the little dune buggy opened his optics and found that he was 
floating right beside a porthole and could see the yellow grasslands rushing 
up to meet them, and he suddenly became calm and even smiled.
�Hey�what�s that?�
To him it looked kind of pretty�but then he realized what it was and all 
senses of calm completely escaped him. � WE�RE GUNNA HIT IT!�

But by then it was too late and ship struck ground HARD.
Skidding along the open fields like a flat stone over a tranquil pond, 
opening up the earth like a sharp scalpel before it finally lost momentum 
and came to a slow stop.
Only to spew fuel from its 2 massive, broken tanks down the backside of the 
charred hull, fiery red hot enough to catch on fire.
Although, by then the 4 Decepticons inside had gathered enough wits about 
them to vacate the area immediately and escape from their possible demise. 
Running for their lives out into the bright sunlight of prehistoric Africa 
just as the very vessel they�d piloted only minuets ago exploded into 
nothing but wasted pieces of slag.
They all watched from a distance as it burned.

�I�m glad we weren�t in there when THAT happened.� Blue Flame commented as 
he stood alongside his Commanding officer at the other 2. Who all seemed to 
be quiet for a moment and contemplate the true words of the blue semi-truck.
Because it WAS true.
They�d lost their ship, but they would have lost their lives if they�d acted 
a moment too late.
But still, Blue Flame had to sigh in disappointment. � But now what are we 
going to do? We lost our research and I don�t even know where we are.� He 
finished, looking around at the foreign planet they�d managed to crash on.
Everyone else did the same.

Mountains loomed up to the East and yellow African plain stretched out in 
every other direction as far as the optic could see. Marred by the odd 
skeletal tree, but that was about it.
Diesel Runner planted her hands onto her metallic hips and studied their 
surroundings closely as the crackling fire of their ship burnt behind them.
� That tare could have taken us anywhere. Because, if you all remember, our 
research recorded that it was a flux in space AND time. So we could be on 
any planet, in any time period. And this place is beginning to look more and 
more familiar the longer I look at it.�
�How so?� Blue Flame asked, the other 2 of their team also looking to the 
broad back of their Commander. Although she continued to look out towards 
the horizon.
� I mean, I�ve seen pictures of this place before back at the Research 
Academy. Or at least a place that looked like this.� She said while 
gesturing with her hand towards the landscape. � This place reminds me of 
the pictures of ancient Earth millions of years before our Ancestors awoke 
and started the Great War. See what I mean? There�s active volcanoes over 
there.� D.R. pointed to a plume of steady smoke rising up from a great 
distance away. � Although 9 chances out of 10, I�m wrong since our exit 
factor of that tare was random. This planet is still generally young, and 
those volcanoes prove it.�

Sand Storm walked up to stand beside the towering black and Decepticon and 
clapped his hands together.
� I can�t WAIT to study this place!�
D.R., although this was no time for light-sparks, couldn�t help but feel the 
same way. But still� �Maybe later, Sand Storm. But right now, we have to 
salvage what equipment we can from the ship. I think all the fuel�s burned 
up now and it�s reasonably safe.� She said as she turned back and observed 
the dying embers of what was left.
� Though, it�s going to take a while�.�
